p: The chemical composition of the EOs from laurel leaves, twigs, and fruits is listed in Table 1. The laurel EO was light yellow and had a specific odor. In the fruit EO of this study, 38 constituents representing 99.3% of the total content were identified. Twelve of the constituents were in concentrations over 1% of the EO. The main constituents in the fruit EO (above 3%) were 1,8-cineole (33.3%), α-terpinyl acetate (10.3%), α-pinene (11.0%), β-elemene (7.45%), sabinene (6.30%), β-phellandrene (5.2%), bornyl acetate (4.38%), and camphene (4.3%).
